repnme.cdata!: Mexico - Social Protection System in Health Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Social Protection System in Health
            Project for Mexico had a satisfactory outcome with low or
            negligible risk to development outcome, and moderately
            satisfactory performances by both the Bank and borrower.
            Significant changes included two Level II restructurings.
            Several lessons were learned.  UHC consists of three
            inter-related components which should be considered: (i)
            coverage for the entire population; (ii) financial
            protection from direct payment for health services when
            consumed; and (iii) the full spectrum of quality health
            services according to need. While Popular Health Insurance
            (PHI) has succeeded in narrowing health funding differences
            between the States, there are still significant differences
            in performance and outcomes, which largely mimic
            socio-economic differences amongst the states. There is a
            need to rethink incentives for the states and their
            providers to improve health care performance. Regarding the
            project's design, many lessons were learned.  The
            Project had a dual aim of protecting financing for PHI
            (which required fast disbursement) and providing technical
            assistance (which required long-term engagement). In loans
            that incorporate a significant component of technical
            assistance, procurement arrangements are crucial to ensure
            that the component will be executed as expected. Where
            appropriate, procurement arrangements should use country
            systems. Even in Programs that aim at universal coverage,
            there is a need for specific approaches and strategies to
            reach the most vulnerable segments of the population.
            Evidence generation and regular monitoring and evaluation
            are crucial for policy, strategy and program decision-making.

repnme.cdata!:
Mexico - Social Protection System in Health
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Social Protection
            System in Health Project for Mexico are to: (i) initially
            preserve and later expand the Popular Health
            Insurance's coverage of people without contributory
            social security; and (ii) strengthen the capacity of the
            commission and state health systems to effectively
            administer the entitlements of the popular health insurance.
            This restructuring paper a level-two restructuring of the
            project to strengthen its results framework and monitoring.
            The changes will allow for a more accurate measurement of
            project progress and will not modify the project development
            objective (PDO) or the associated outcome targets.

display_title.display_title:
Mexico - Social Protection System
            in Health Project : restructuring  : Main report
